newsitem.title: USA: Wholesale sales boost NIMO power sales.
newsitem.headline: Wholesale sales boost NIMO power sales.

text.p: Niagara Mohawk Power Corp said Thursday total electricity sales increased 3.8 percent last year with wholesale sales up 26.2 percent as a result of the increased demand for electricity in the northeast during the year.
Retail sales of electricity in 1996 were up 1.2 percent, primarily due to higher industrial sales, the company said.

In the fourth quarter, retail sales of electricity were up 0.8 percent compared to the final quarter of 1995, again reflecting higher industrial sales, while residential and commercial sales were down 2.9 percent and 2.2 percent, respectively. Total electricity sales in the fourth quarter were down 1.1 percent, Niagara Mohawk said.
